replies.msg:
Sorry for my English written response - I am just trying to react to this promptly (please dont diu me): 
5f0a7fb0d8f451711016668

That's a challenging topic. You don't actually have any references for a one-time event like this. Any modeling results you create would have been a counter-factual result, which again could be assumption driven. All you can do in this paper is to show the spread rate of the disease and study the impact of the entry rate of the infected individuals into HK. However, I think showing such benefit of traveling ban seems to be quite trivial. I suspect that most impactful journals, if not all, care about theoretical contributions rather than practical implications. So, I am not entirely sure if such modeling results would be taken for a publication in a top journal.

Sorry for my English written response - I am just trying to react to this promptly (please dont diu me): 
5f0a7fb0d8f451711016668

That's a challenging topic. You don't actually have any references for a one-time event like this. Any modeling results you create would have been a counter-factual result, which again could be assumption driven. All you can do in this paper is to show the spread rate of the disease and study the impact of the entry rate of the infected individuals into HK. However, I think showing such benefit of traveling ban seems to be quite trivial. I suspect that most impactful journals, if not all, care about theoretical contributions rather than practical implications. So, I am not entirely sure if such modeling results would be taken for a publication in a top journal.
